title: How to make people fall in love with me - Quora

response.answer_text: Be The Drug That They NEED - Different people bring out different emotional experiences within us. Some people are incredibly effective at making us feel amazing. This doesn’t mean buy this person gifts, this means learn how to be a fun sexually confident force in their lives. You do this by understanding how to make people feel emotions by modulating your voice to make them laugh, sensually touching them during conversation and understanding what emotional experience they want to feel within that context. Here is a video I made on how to become the drug that people need in life. 2. Letting Them Invest in You - In love you have to let people invest in you as a person. This means letting them do nice things for you, letting them go out of their way from you, letting them show you that you are important. We as human’s need to invest ourselves in people in order to love them. It’s weird, we tend to care about the people we do things for more than the people who do things for us. Scientist think it’s because we have to rationalize why we are going out of our way for that person. 3. Get into Fights Sometimes - Love isn’t just thinking fondly of someone, it’s feeling strongly for someone, and in order to feel strongly for someone you have to feel a spectrum of emotions. That includes negative emotions. Also, fighting with someone is a sign that you care about your relationship and that’s why their actions bother you. It’s also a sign that you trust the strength of the relationship enough to withstand a full blown argument, that trust helps build love. 4. Be Hot - Look I’m not going to beat around the bush, it’s easier to love hot people. This for a myriad of reasons, one those reasons being status, the others being biological, and lastly, we take in a lot of information about the world through our eyes. Just work out, get a nice body, keep your fashion on point, and look like someone your partner wants to brag to her friends about being with. 5. Cuddle, Pillow Talk, and other Soft Stuff - I never feel more like I love a girl than a post sex cuddle, where she’s running her fingers through my hair, I’m caressing her body, and we’re talking about our dreams one second and an embarrassing moment the next. We put a lot of emphasis on sex when it comes to love, but I think the post sex bliss is just as important. I wrote a book called “The Power Bible” click this link to find out more!

This is one of the most important questions when it comes to romantic relationships. A great number of studies that have been conducted prove that we really can control love. Because in general, this is just a basic psychological emotion like fear, joy, pity, and other emotions that can be regulated if they are monitored well. So, how do we use psychology and psychological tricks to learn to make others fall in love with us? The most important thing you need to understand is that the other person must at least have minimal feelings for you. Then, you will be able to turn these into real, deep feelings, easily and quickly 1. Don’t get ice cream on the first date.  Social psychologist John Bargh who works at Yale University studies the role of unconscious processing on social behavior. Some of his studies found an interesting connection between the body temperature of a person and their psychological state. It turned out that when we are physically warm, we are more likely to be nice and friendly to other people. This trick may really come in handy, for example, during a first date when it’s especially important to gain the person’s trust. So remember this and make sure that in the future you choose only warm places, foods, and drinks so that every meeting you have (both romantic and business-related) goes well. 2. The advantages of extended eye contact  Harvard psychologist Zick Rubin conducted a study to try to understand if it’s possible to measure love. He found the answer in the eyes, or more specifically, in the frequency and duration that people look at each other. He found that that couples who are deeply in love look at each other 75% of the time during a conversation and that they stop looking at each other reluctantly. In a normal conversation, people look at each other from 30% to 60% of the time. However, looking into someone’s eyes may not only be a consequence of being in love but it could be the reason. When you look at someone for a long time and you do it frequently, you trick the person’s mind because it remembers what the “love look” is. So, it starts thinking romantically about you. The nervous system starts producing phenethylamine which causes the sensations that we have when we fall in love: “butterflies in the stomach,” an increased heart rate, warm palms. How could anyone resist? 3. Tell them something awkward about yourself.  It’s obvious that an open and a communicative person has more chances to be liked. So there is nothing surprising about the fact that if you fearlessly share facts about yourself and your life, you make other people like you. According to a study conducted by the scientists from Harvard Business School, 79% of subjects preferred to be open and sincere people during first dates. They didn’t hide anything, even when it came to weird habits, tastes, awkward situations that happened to them, and even negative character traits. Because it works just like secrets: when we tell someone a secret, there is a special connection between us and the person based on trust and understanding. 4. Don’t do anything. Just let them do something for you.  When we do a good thing or help someone, we feel good. We are happy with ourselves and have very warm emotions for the person we helped. When we justify our effort, we idealize the person we were so generous to and convince ourselves that they deserve this treatment. As a result, we have an emotional anchor and start liking the person even more. On the other hand, when someone does something for us, we like it too. But it’s about different emotions and not all of them are very positive. We mostly feel as if we owe to the person and we need to pay them back. Things are even harder when this is someone we don’t really like. So, we should keep this physcological effect in mind. 5. Make up a secret language just for the 2 of you.  This is about inside jokes, special words, and unique gestures that happen between people when they find common ground and become truly close. Maybe you like the same movie, comedy show, song, book, or even meme. And maybe the joke appeared spontaneously during your first date, a walk together, or a meeting. Don’t ignore these little things. When you find and use this phrase in your everyday communication, you will take your relationship to whole new level. The relationship will become even stronger and more intimate. The scientists from Texas University came to this conclusion in their study. We all want to be special and unique, and this secret language helps us feel that we understand each other better than anyone else. 6. The size of the pupils matter.  n a study from the 60s and 70s, scientists researched the connection between the size of the pupil and the attractiveness of a person. They showed men 2 photos of the same woman. The photos were identical except for one little detail — in one of the photos, the pupils of the lady were bigger. As a result, the men liked the edited photo more even though nobody noticed the difference in eyes. There is a way to use this effect to your advantage. Of course, you can’t change the size of your pupil on purpose, but you can make the conditions right, for example, dim the light. Use candles instead of regular lights. Or plan to go to a restaurant that is famous for its relaxing atmosphere. 7. Be near them often... But then, make them miss you.  In our dreams, we can all find someone we like, tell them about our feelings, and live together happily ever after. In the real world, things are not that easy, that’s why people need to come up with special tactics. Of course, it’s important to spend more time together when the feeling is mutual. In order to know each other better, to break the ice and build a connection, you need to spend some time together. But after several dates, psychologists recommend to take a break (even if you don’t want to) to make a deficit of your presence in the other person’s life. This move achieves several things: You won’t get tired of each other (over time, feelings stop being so new, and in order to keep them alive, you need to play hard-to-get);The person gets the chance to understand how nice and important this relationship has become for them (limited and rare things are always more desired);You can take control of your own emotions and think clearly.8. Make a positive association  You can program someone else’s brain by repeating the same thoughts over and over again. This is why it’s so important to carefully choose words when communicating with people who are very important to us. You can use this principle to improve your image. The better you present yourself, the more positive thoughts you will leave in a person’s mind even when you are not around. And it doesn’t really matter if you are really so positive (everyone has their flaws). The only thing that matters here is how you are perceived and how you want to be perceived. Then again after all these they may still not like you,cause its all about personal choice,just believe that you’ll get someone and don’t give up.

If you wait the other person you admire will fall in naturally with you then you should be hero of a movie, else you will be waiting forever. if you feel you have already fallen in love with someone on their first look or few meetups then You need to impress the other person to fall in love with you. Because at the end of the day, all we care about is looks, no one falls in love with your personality at your first look neither it going happen by chance luckily. You see, love is no different to other psychological emotions that you might experience on a day-to-day basis such as: Jealousy, fear, anger, anxiety. As these above emotions can be controlled, and as love falls under the category of “psychological emotions,”  it can also be controlled. Controlling love as an emotion is just as easy as controlling fear, excitement or stress etc.  The problem lies in what we have been taught to believe. Over the years, we’ve been conditioned to believe that love is something that “just happens.” It all depends on “fate.” The reality however is far different. With the right knowledge, you can use the psychology of love to make him or her fall in love with you.  Now, nothing’s perfect, which means this won’t work 100% all the time, but you’ll improve your chances dramatically. If you could triple your chances at making someone genuinely fall in love with you, why wouldn’t you try?  1. Psychologically aspect.  Before even thinking about going down the road of learning how to make a person fall madly in love with you, you need to take a look at the psychological aspect of it, and no, it has nothing to do with magic potions and midnight under the moon chanting sessions. Without even realising it, you and everyone else you know has a checklist stored in the back of your mind. On this list there’s a set criteria, a criteria that your potential love interest must meet before you will be able to fall in love with them. Psychologists call this list a ‘Lovemap.’ If someone doesn’t match one or more of the points in this list, they’re automatically disqualified as a potential love partner and they’re likely to just remain your friend, this is why you might fall in love with one person while others will just be your “friends.” Of course each person’s checklist is different and unique. The items on your list depend on your:	Values, Beliefs, Past experiences, Background and Previous relationships. This is also the reason why your friend might fall in love with a man that you consider ordinary and nothing special. This man matches her own unique ‘Lovemap,’ not yours. Calculating matches to see if a person lives up to our checklist is not a conscious action on our part, it’s done subconsciously, without thinking about it. The mind does it all on its own. Just like your mind is telling your heart to beat as your reading this page. Even though you weren’t consciously aware of it. This is why it’s possible to fall in love with a person and have no idea why you fell in love with them in the first place. Your subconscious is responsible. This is why love is such a “mysterious phenomenon” and many people put it all down to their own personal destiny. But in reality, it has nothing to do with fate, it was all related to your subconscious, which was quietly figuring out whether the person matches your checklist or not. The truth of the matter is that if you’re able to grow more aware of your subconscious mind’s specific criteria, you’ll be able to quickly determine why you fall for some people and not for others. 2. Making a strong impression The first thing you wanna do is impress him/her. Doing anything like helping others, standing for a good cause, telling truth, speech, voice, guesture or even making good jokes. The other person need to admire you in any certain way. 3.Take good care of yourself.  Physical appearance plays a huge role in whether or not someone will be attracted to someone else.  How well you care for your physical health and appearance is something that people can see right away, so it is worth putting some extra time and energy into while you are trying to attract someone. People will notice if you don’t care for yourself and this may make someone lose interest. 4. Treat them special  you wanna to treat them very special via phone conversation, chats, or social media via anything. Atleast the other person wanna to believe that you dnt treat them like others. there is something special in their case.  5. Trying to understand them  This is difficult in beginning but you want to try harder to understand what they thinks when they are in silent and guessing their answer before they answer their question. And what are their likes and dislikes.  In what ever things they are interested to do, how they dream about their life partner.  6.Fulfill their wish  If you come their wish or likes try to surprise them by fulfilling it. Remember their Birthday or any special occasion and treat that day very specially.  7.Use your mutual friends  If you and your heart’s desire have friends in common, you can and should use this to your advantage. The main reason behind this is because the subconscious is programmed easier when trusted sources (such as friends) are backing up what they are being programmed with. If their friends think you are great, chances are they will agree. If their friends think you’re an idiot, chances are they will agree. In a way it’s a subtle form of brainwashing – the more your mutual friends talk to them about how wonderful you are you’ll have a greater chance of establishing a place in their mind.  8.Associate yourself with positive things.   When your name is mentioned in a crowd, what’s the first word that’s likely to come to peoples’ minds? How do they see you? Do they think ‘strong-willed’, ‘happy’, ‘confident’, or is it something more negative like ‘needy’? The better you position yourself in peoples minds, the better people will perceive you. It doesn’t matter what you are (we all have negative qualities), it’s all about how they perceive you. And you’ll only want them to perceive you in a positive light.  9. Be Kind   Treat others the way you want to be treated. It may sound cheesy, but it's true. If you want others to treat you with care and respect, you should start treating others this way way, too. People are more likely to fall in love with other people who have great personalities, who are polite, and who are kind to others  10.Show your flaws.   Share your good qualities with your significant other but also let him or her see how far you’ve come. For example, if you getup late in morning and trying harder to getup early but confess you fail on holidays.  11.Create trust.   Trust is an essential component in a healthy, long-lasting relationship. Learn to trust your significant other and show that you trust him or her with your words and actions. Make sure that you show your significant other that you are trustworthy as well.  12.Support other during difficult times.  Offering support is very important to creating true love between two people. Most people want to be in relationships to begin with because they like having someone to support them. If you can be supportive and caring to your significant other, this will go a long way towards getting the person to fall in love with you  13. Don't fall in best friend category.  You should give your significant other the same consideration you would give a good friend but all check to that you don't stay as their one of the best friend category. Make them feel that they are very special than your best friends.  14.Spend quality time together.  Even if it is in phone call or msg, try to spend quality time together which later make them to miss you on your absence.  15.Tell them your feelings  Confess how you feel for them. how your heart beat rise when you see them. How you see them as a part of your future. How much happiness you get to see her smile.  Note:  For few boys, the list goes on..  For few girls, just a smile is enough.  Warnings:  1. Dont Flirt Don't behave as flirter in front of them neither with them unless you create a good bonding. 2. Don't be too good or too bad Be safe, revealing yourself too good or too bad or too childish can create a distance. 3. Don't be like Hero It is impossible to make someone fall in love with you. If you do all of the things discussed above and they still don’t love you, then they are probably incapable of loving you (or already in love with someone else) and the two of you were a poor match. Some people are simply incompatible, even if one person feels very strongly for the other. It may be hard to hear, but you are better off ending a relationship if the other person simply cannot return your feelings. Don't turn movie hero and started drinking and go behind her.  4.Don't be like Villain also   Don't be clingy or pushy with someone who's rejected your feelings. Anyone that you have to try too hard to convince to like you is not worth all the trouble and will probably never like you. Pursuing a relationship too hard will only make you creepy and push people further away. Don't do anything harmful to them or things that might hurt them.  4.Not Interested, move on  Try, with all your heart, to match with your love and do your best for them. And if it doesn't work, you found that they are not interested in you then all you can do is move on. 5.Don't create sympathy Many people fail to make the other person fall in love with them, then they start threaten them or create sympathy for them to give a final chances. It will create more anger on you.

This is actually long, but thought it will help those guys out there who are used to thinking that impressing girls with their swag clothings will make them fall in love. You got to read this. Let's get started. Getting a girl of your dreams is much like getting the car of your dream. But unlike a car which you can always bargain for, there is nothing like a 20 percent discount in courting the girl of your dreams, she's so sweet a thing to be discounted, you dearly are in love with her and your feelings for her can only be communicated not by the words of the mouth, but by the words of the heart. Getting the girl actually depends on how big your heart is - faint heart, never won fair lady.  The first dating idea for any man is to make a good impression. In your doing so, you don't have to talk, dress or do the common things that all the Toms do to get a decent girl's attention. Be unique, that's all you need. Be a man of his own style. Dress decently - indecency can make one be mistaken for arrogance; watch your language - obscene language gives the impression of immaturity, being uncultured and cheap; be a man of good habits - don't drink or smoke like any other loser.  How to make her fall in love with you? Take your time. Add some romance to your dating style. When in College I had a crush on the most beautiful lady in our first year lot. Though all senior guys were out to get that girl, I managed to divert her attention from the other guys. I wrote her three letters without disclosing my identity and slid into her room secretly; all I said was 'Yours Secret Admirer.' The first letter contained the meaning of her name, this I got by playing around with the initials of her name to make meaning. The second was a funny message that could only be read backwards and it was all about her physique and her smartness. In the third letter I told the girl to be ready to receive a rose flower from her admirer, but only if she could be kind enough to phone him using a number that I had included in the letter. The girl did phone me that very night, and her first words to me were, "Hallo Secret Admirer." So, the story of our love affair came to be. Later she told me that was so creative of me, no one had approached her in that manner. I made her fall in love with me and made a date in the romantic manner.  Befriending and understanding the girl you are out to get is the next important thing. This is what I also did. You have to understand that as a lady, she loves to be loved, adores to be adored and needs to be needed. This will move you closer to the girl and you'll get to know what she's into, what she likes and dislikes, and what her style is. Love is built upon friendship and it always leaves individuals better off having known each other should they break up. I and my College steady were to break some time later but to date, we are the best of buddies. Be sure that bringing out the selflessness friend in you will make her create room for you in her heart.  A shoulder to lean on and some good friend that she can always turn to is all that a lady wants. Please don't hesitate to be helpful and supportive. Be that friend who rekindles her zeal of hardworking and restoring hope back into her life when she looses hope. This above all other things will make you her daily vitamin simply because you bring out the best in her in terms of personality and character. In you, she'll have found that friend whom she can open up to, share with and advice each other on the rights and wrongs, the dos and don'ts of life. Don't forget to always be there to celebrate the good times, and to lend an ear when the girl needs you to listen as a friend.  Make the girl feel special; because she's someone's friend - your friend, and let her know that she too has touched your life in a unique way like no one else could. Compliment her for her company and for being there when you needed her, when you felt sad and all alone. Show appreciations for the comfort the girl offers you and for making you smile.  In your day to day talks, share your dreams, your world, and every aspect of your life with your girl. Always dream with her, build with her, and always cheer her on and encourage her. Tell your girl how you always think about her even when you try not to think about her. Let the girl know that she's your first thing in the morning and the last thing when you go to bed at night.  Her knowing that you were thinking of her when you slipped beneath the softness of your blanket and gave in to the bliss of sweet dreams, will make her go 'my my' and her heart will sing your name all the year round.  You have to be creative and constructive to keep girl's interest in you so full of life. I remember one time I told my girlfriend to be to imagine we are both deaf and dump. We then sat opposite each other on the table and started sharing our feelings for each other using eyes and hand signs. It turned out to be some fun. There was also this time that we were in the library and we decided we are not going to speak to each other verbal, so I wrote a love note on a paper and passed it across the table to her, she replied and on and on we carried on our love on paper conversation till we almost exhausted a whole rim of paper. At sometime, I noticed that some guys sited with us on the table were enjoying our ordeal than their studies. Such are the things that made the girl embrace my world. I remember her suggesting that we play deaf and dump two years after we broke up, can you imagine that?  Never fail to phone her, even when she least expects it. I once called some girl that I was interested in at four o'clock in the morning. When inquiring of what I was doing up so early, I told her I was in thirteenth heaven, where people think of their loved ones when they can't sleep. Wow! First thing early the next morning, she was at my door with a king-sized hug for me. No matter how many dates you take her, don't make any elbow - exceeding moves after any date, just drop her home and with a friendly handshake, wish her good night. Don't kiss her when she expects you to. Your respect as a gentleman will be earned on how patient you are with her when it comes to such matters as kissing her and accessing her inner graces.  The writing is on the wall that you want her, but you can't have her just yet. Increase your demand. Try to show her that men are also hard to get at times. Make her realize that when she feels a little dizzy, a little tired, a little sad, a little sick, a lot bored and very much cold, she's actually missing vitamin you. By this time, she'll be so much into you and since love is truthful and is characterized by open and honest communication, honestly promise her your everlasting devotion, loyalty, respect, and your unconditional love for a lifetime. Prove to her that you'll always be there for her, to listen and to hold her hand, and that you'll always do your best to make her happy, and feel loved.  Remember, patience is the key to her heart; be like that gardener watching a fruit as it hangs on the tree, day after day admiring it, but, exercising tremendous self-discipline, neither feeling the fruit, nor pinching it, nor testing it to see if it is ready. And then, one day he holds out his hand and the fruit simply drops into it, ripe, warm and eager to be eaten.  The patience and self-control which you practice will make you more attractive and charming. This will qualify you as her daily vitamin and win you that heart hers.  I wish you to meet the girl of your dreams ASAP, make her fall in love with you, and make her feel the happiest girl in the world!

1 ) Be mysterious but not closed off. This doesn’t mean wearing a fedora or being the weird quiet one in the corner. When talking to that person, generate curiosity and intrigue. You do this by teasing them with information. If they ask where you’re from, simply state where that is and a quick one liner about the town. Don’t be so quick to tell your whole life story. You want them to discover you. Unpack you. The most interesting room in the house is the one that’s locked. Always. 2 ) Keep them guessing.In the courtship phase while you two are still feeling each other out, don’t fall into a routine. Text them at random times. Go on spontaneous hangouts together. Always try new things and bring them along for the ride. People want to spend time with others who add value to their lives. Keeping things interesting will multiply their interest in you ten fold. 3 ) Be busy but not unavailable.You’re a renaissance man/woman. You have many interests, hobbies and people vying for your company. You wouldn’t throw all that away for one person. Make it clear to them that you have things going on outside the relationship. They’ll appreciate you more and it’ll be a self esteem boost for them to think they’re “worth” your time. I can’t stress the second part of this tip enough. If you want them to fall for you, you have to be emotionally available. Answer their late night phone call when they’re feeling stressed. Don’t blow them off just to appear busy. You’re toeing a fine line here so use proper judgement. 4 ) Get them to share personal stories. We are sensitive creatures at heart. Hearing someone’s deep, dark secrets is the closest we’ll ever get to holding a horcrux. That’s part of their soul they entrusted you with. The caveat with this is the only way you’ll get their horcrux, is by giving up one of your own. You have to open up and be vulnerable yourself if you want them to reciprocate the favor. 5 ) Be the honest version of yourself. Not the best. Or the coolest. Or the most suave. This is the person you are at five in the morning and 12 at night. The last thing you wanna do is put up a grandiose facade of being the “ultimate man/woman” (The masculinity of Rambo, the style of James Bond, a Seth Rogan sense of humor, John Mayer sensitivity, and Sam Harris intelligence) Trying to be all these things is exhausting and will cause long term frustration and feelings of inadequacy. At the end of the day, you want them to fall in love with YOU. Not a perfectly sculpted, idealized version of you. If you liked this, I also write about the 5 levels of deep conversation and more on Medium.

When I was in my twenties, I wanted so badly to be loved and I often asked myself this same question; how do I make someone fall in love with me? I often wondered why others were loved without even trying and why, for me, it took so so much effort. Whenever I had a crush on a girl, I would create this image in my mind of what is supposed to be a perfect guy, and then try to emulate that image. The results were always the same. The perception young women had of me was that of someone who was uncomfortable in his own skin. A spazz; hardly any fun, let alone lovable. When these brief romances ended, or never got off the ground, there was a young woman I was friends with whom I would turn to for consolation and advice. When I was with her, I didn't feel the need to put on any airs and as time went on she fell in love with me. Looking back, I did not consciously do anything to make her love me, it just happened. When I was around my crushes, I was trying to be someone I was not. When I was with her, I was myself, and that must have been enough. We dated for two years before we ended up breaking up. Staying in love, well, that's another topic. As I got older, I became more comfortable with myself and realized that I was likable and worthy of being loved. Gradually, my life changed. Friends and lovers were not people I actively pursued, they were people that effortlessly became part of my life. You reach a point of comfort and self-acceptance where these things just fall into place. Not everyone will fall in love with you. A lot of times the chemistry or attraction is not there. When you are comfortable with yourself, and you like who you are, there is a pretty good chance that someone you have a crush on will also be drawn to and fall in love with you. You'll get there, it just takes time.

Here are a few tips which can help you win someone’s love for you :- BE A GOOD LISTENER. Out there are many people who just wants to tell people about their problems but mostly they don’t find someone who wants to listen to what they say and not just ignore with Hmm… SO be a listener to them as they want one for sure.GET THEIR ATTENTION. It’s very important to get someone’s attention as this is when they truly see your actions and you are always in their mind. To get attention some easy tips are -be a topper (it really helps).be good at making pranks in class or make people laugh.it’s very important to be expressive so whenever you get a chance to express your opinion never back off.3. SOME PSYCHOLOGICAL ASPECTS :- Don’t start a conversation without any point. I mean it’s a bad idea to just start by sending a “hii” randomly, rather go for a more meaningful start i.e start something work related face to face and then go for online chats.Don’t just ask your friends for the whatsapp number or facebook id. Instead ask him/her for the number and know whether they are comfortable sharing their numbers with you and then go for chatting. Love is a gentlemen process, so have CLASS and don’t look like a roadside romeo.Don’t go for compliments directly, rather wait and try to know about her/him. If you compliment them easily it’ll make them feel like you are lying. Instead be a listener and keep your chats short in the initial days and as time progress, go for normal chats and following it will be personal life. Show interest in chats and act with patience.Once you get to know her/him better, then one day just confess you like them. Confess in the way that they are shocked. This will be a game changer, either it works or it doesn’t. If she/he replies that they also like you but they need to time to think about you it’s well and good. if not they’ll say a direct NO!! which I think is a rare answer. In that case limit you interaction and chats. They’ll rather go for I don’t know!! so just confess that you just wanted to get this off your chest and now you are feeling relieved. Talk formally afterwards and then slowly he/she will show interest in you if they like you. Their perception regarding you will change and this is when real talk starts.4. TOUCH SENSITIVE TOPICS :- If you like someone then sensitive topics when you are with them. Topics such as their lost dream, their problems, their failures or anything which concerns with them. Trust me they’ll spill out slowly what they feel and they’ll get attached to you and they’ll not even know that. Don’t behave like a counsellor and start giving them advice. Trust me this’ll backfire so it’s better to just listen and make them feel comfortable. 5. DON’T BE AMONG THE CROWD :- After you have gained that person’s trust make sure you both get time alone and go out for parks, movies, eat outs. This is when you’ll be the only one who she/he knows in that crowd and this will surely deepen the bond. Make sure you talk about your dreams once she/he is into you. This is the time when you talk and the other person listens. They are interested in you and once you have shared you heart out he/she will be happy and they’ll understand that they mean something in your life and this is when they’ll fall for you. 6. THE FINAL TEST:- When the person is into you then start showing physical touches. I mean holding hands in public, frequent hugs, kissing on cheeks/foreheads and rest you can imagine. Without physical closeness the LOVE and relationship will be incomplete so it’s important. I am not supporting and wrong ideas, physical closeness only when both are comfortable.  At last making someone fall in love with you is no science. Some people are meant for you and others aren’t , so the above steps may not work all the time. Getting someone who loves you is a blessing and even if you have put your heart into getting them , you can just HOPE for a YES!!  Pic credits :- google

Be a listener, make good eye contact, smile a lot, make them feel special or WAIT! If you still think that these stuff work exactly the way they’re depicted to, then Welcome to reality Nobody will actually wait for you to learn the art of perfect body language or maintaining such charisma  However, from what I have observed and experienced, I can surely suggest some things that might work. So, 1.Never act like you want to be loved Psychology says that if 9 out of 10 people in your life love you, you’ll still fall for the one who doesn’t.  • People are usually attracted towards the ones who never ask for their attention. • And most of the times they ignore the ones who actually look like they’re begging for love. 2.Don’t tryna be the nice guy/girl Never ever go that extra mile to be considered as nice or sweet by the people around you. Remember the last time when you tried to be good to everyone and ended up being the dumbest person? Don’t repeat that. Be who you are, proud in your own skin and mindset.  3.Know how people exactly deserve to be treated Be kind to the kind hearted, humble to the innocent ones, helpful to the needy and a complete badass to pesky dumbskulls.  This skill can surely attract the masses. 4.Work on yourself  Leave no stone unturned to be that version of yourself whom you’d actually love to meet. Skin care? Fitness? Hairstyle? Stable Job? Money? Don’t stop until you’ve ticked all the boxes. And don’t forget to love yourself in your process.Treat yourself as the most significant person you know, which of course you’re, for yourself. Always remember, If you don’t love yourself, people will see that from far away and nobody else is gonna love you. 5.Lastly, Confidence never goes out of style. And how do you expect to carry all these qualities in yourself, without the snazzy touch of confidence?  . ~Crimson times:)

Tough answer! As it’s impossible to find ONE solution that works on everyone. However, I can offer a few tips that I’ve learned (sometimes the hard way): BE YOURSELF : I can’t stress this enough. No matter what the person you’re trying to attract is like, no matter what their personality type is, or how impressive they are; trust yourself and be yourself. You will emanate the strongest confidence when you are in your “personality comfort zone” and not trying to be someone else, or to impress them in unauthentic ways. Sometimes, even when you may feel like you are too different from them for them to be interested (aka “Aw damn they’re like a musician type they’re never going to like me, I don’t know jack shit about music.”) but that’s exactly what you can use to make them like you more. Don’t try to mirror them if you aren’t like them. To reuse that example, don’t pretend to know and enjoy their music if you don’t; there’s nothing more annoying than someone who tries to kiss up but fails because its fake. Use your difference to ask them about themselves, (reusing my example) ask them about their music, maybe to share it with you, to teach it to you. When people try to get to know you, you’re much more likely to be interested in them then when they act like they ARE you.STAY CHILL : Being a stress case and trying too hard can be really a turn off, so act like it’s them who want you. Take the upper hand! Play hard to get a little bit! If you’re down on your knees for them, trying to make everything perfect and please them in every way, they’re going to get bored. Spice things up and make them want you. Calm confidence emanates a really strong “cool” vibe because it seems that you are 100% sure of yourself, and you aren’t even trying.FLIRT AWAY : If there’s any place you can allow yourself to try and adapt to them, it’s here. Figure out what type of flirting they respond to by trying different things. And try to stay original! We all get bored of “heyyyy” texts. Try something different like engaging into a real conversation, and then slip in some discreet compliments when you can. The flirting needs to smoothly fit into your interactions, not be something you shove in their face. It’s always better to wait a little than waste a move in a situation where you aren’t feeling 100% sure of it. For example, over social media, don’t comment on all their stuff desperately. Wait until they post something you actually have something interesting to say about and THEN hit them with a conversation. In real life, don’t ask them out constantly on random dates, wait until there’s a real opportunity (ex: a band you both like is in town; there’s a cool art expo you know they like; they like coffee and you just found a sick coffee spot etc….) and THEN ask them out.

So what can you do to make someone fall in love with you? Follow these things and you can try. 1. Put Other People First:- Everyone wants to spend their life with someone who is kind and loving. We all want to have that one person who makes us feel important. And we are all drawn to people who do good in this world. If you are someone who has a giving attitude, then you have a good shot of making someone fall in love with you. This doesn’t mean you have to give to them constantly to make them fall in love with you. It just means that you show them that you have an altruistic attitude and the ability to act on that attitude when necessary. 2. Ask The Right Questions:- Want to create a conversation that will help them see how great you are? Ask the right questions. Ask the questions that inspire excitement and passion in them, and then create a conversation around those things that make them see you as someone they have connected with and will be able to connect with for a long time to come. 3. Look Into Each Other’s Eyes:- That same study found that staring into each other’s eyes had a big impact on making someone fall in love with you. I have heard variations of how long to do this, but 10 minutes seems to be the point where an altered state of consciousness is reported and creates a special type of intimacy, especially when combined with the previous questions. 4. Make Someone Feel Comfortable Enough To Be Vulnerable:- When someone feels vulnerable around you (not because of you), you have a chance at winning them over. Perhaps this is why men often take their date to a scary movie. It puts their date in a vulnerable state where they need their date to protect them – or at least that is the stereotype. In any case, if you can get someone to depend on you or require your support or care, you will deepen the bond between the two of you and have a chance of making them fall in love with you. 5. Mirror The Person You Are Interested In 6. Cure Their Loneliness 7. Make Them Laugh 8. Work On Your Appearance 9. Be Clear About Your Feelings 10. Back Away:- Creating some distance is one of the ways to make someone fall in love with you when you have been too needy. When you are in someone’s face too much, it can be hard for them to get the space they need to assess your positive qualities that they find attractive. Backing away gives them some breathing space and allows them to stop focusing on your neediness and, instead, focus on what you can offer them. 11. Become A Part Of Their Routine 12. Increase Your Energy I hope these points will be more than enough to make someone fall in love with you. All the Best…!!! Thank You…!!!

We can try! It IS a gamble we have to take - and I would not have chosen any other way, whether reciprocated or not. I experienced the most unique “calling” as such - the person I absolutely least expected. The person who blew me away… The person who was so phenomenal they could not visualise just how brilliant they really were and probably never will. And Yes - brilliance is the word - the most amazing, incredible person I will ever have the privilege to state that I knew. I was blessed - and that will remain so for eternity. If I told the story of that “calling” one might argue that I was crazy, lost my marbles as such! BUT…. the Universe - it has a unique and unexpected ability sometimes to enable two stars to collide - an ability to allow a perfect stranger to delve into your soul. If anyone on this planet experienced the same situation the sensation is that of euphoria - I was truly blessed. I began to realise the wonders that our world holds… and I know that experience will never happen to me again in this lifetime. I realise as I get older that loving someone is unconditional - we do not “love” necessarily to receive in return. We “love” because regardless of the outcome, we want the best for the other person… always… no matter what life may throw in the mix. And no matter what hardship we may face as the outcome. I know that I will never experience that “calling” again - I always felt I was not meant to give my heart away - but I did. And it was not in vain - hopefully one day that person will realise the wonder and the magic he holds in his soul. He will always be the most incredible person I ever will have had the privilege of knowing. Always and until time exists no more….

You got to understand who you really are. And you got to understand the person right in front of you. Every person has his/her unique set of personality traits, an equally engaging but very different origin story, and his/her own unique perspective regarding life. Firstly you have to accept one truth- that you just can't satisfy everybody. Understanding who you really are and who you can't be, and understanding what a person is really looking for in you, will help you get an insight pretty early whether this is going to work or not. My gut feelings always have a better accuracy than the logical arguments by my brain (often, our brains get dizzy when we are with someone we find too attractive, and the arguments which we think are logical, are attempts to fight until the end, a battle which we know we’ll lose). People subconsciously tend to have a check list of personality traits which they would ideally want in their perfect partner. This check list gets revised as we grow up- for example, when we were in school, it was a common thing to get attracted to the hottest girls in our batch (those who could take us to the dark side), however as I grew up, I saw a lot of my childhood classmates whom I never considered approaching- now surpassing the level of hotness of the kind of girls who usually pulled my eyes in school. This taught me one important lesson- that hotness shouldn't be an eliminating criteria when I am looking for a girlfriend, because in the long run people do change a lot, and who you perceive as someone “not in your league” could someday turn out to be “out of your league” as well. Every single person has his/her day, and on their best days they will always get the better of you. So if someone rejects you today, ten years down the line its perfectly possible that if you cross roads with that someone, he/she might regret that decision. If that person has been going through a rough time, he might now appreciate how supportive your nature is, or what an amazing listener you are, that after a very long time he/she has been talking to someone the whole night at one stretch. The idea I tried to convey here is that every person subconsciously has his/her own check list of desirable traits that they want in their partner, and based on the long term experiences that person has had (failed relationships in the past, or events that left a scar), and the more pressing recent experiences (for example, loss of someone really close, or being cheated upon, or stress), that checklist keeps getting revised and divided into sections like- Traits I can't compromise with, and Traits I would like but definitely not mandatory. Through conversations you have to know what are these mandatory traits and whether you have it or not. When you are not communicating with a person effectively, you'll never get to know what that person is going through- lack of communication kills your chances to be what that person needs at one particular point of time. If you're not there for him/her, someone else might just get lucky. Someone might like you to take control and plant a passionate kiss on her lips on the first date itself because she has been craving for pleasure. However, if you assume that for everyone, it will definitely backfire, because its possible that one person recently had some really traumatic experience and now because of your move, perceives you as yet another desperate guy. What one woman perceives sexual could also be casual for someone else. Hence in order to really earn someone's love, you have to invest time in understanding that person first- what are her ambitions, what does she expect from her partner, what turns her on, what turns her off, what has she been going through. Effective communication is a trait which I consider as foundation for modern interpretation of love. Without communication, everything falls apart, no matter how deeply you are in love with someone. In order to make someone fall in love with you, you have to be a good lover first- learn how to give, without expecting to get something back in return. I talked about checklists- and every person has one common trait that he/she finds desirable in a partner- selflessness. A selfless partner instills the feeling of love (the urge to give everything without expecting anything in return) within you. Hit the upvote button if you agree. I am eager for your comments. This happens to be my first answer on Quora, give some love!

What most people would say to that is no. Love is not something you can force yourself to feel. But it definitely is something that can grow. It has to have the right circumstances and at least the willingness of the person you love to want to give it a try. I have as an example the personal experience of a close friend. Coming from an abusive childhood, followed by a marriage from Hell, she was really emotionally damaged and so scared. I think at the time she started dating again simply to deter her insane ex. She met this guy online who seemed absolutely besotted with her. I remember each time she would talk about him she would be angry with herself for not being able to feel anything at all for him, as he was a genuinely nice guy. He wasn’t her type if anything she would find him slightly boring and she decided to do the right thing and tell him all of that. His answer was “Yes I know, thank you for telling me. Where would you like to go for dinner tonight?” Over ten years later, 3 kids later they have an amazing relationship. Still not married as she’s terrified of the idea. She’s as besotted with him now as he was with her from day one. So yes, you can make someone love you if you give them the love, respect, attention and support they deserve and they are willing to try. However, it’s very important to remember what kind of a person you choose to give all that to. Some people would take your love for granted and the more you try the least they would even like you. Trying to make someone love you, puts you in a very vulnerable position and there are a lot of bad people out there who would blatantly take advantage of that. As with anything else involving feelings and relationships there are no rules set in stone and you have to use your own discretion. The most important thing to remember is, just because you can’t make one person love you, it doesn’t mean someone else won’t.

Offer them something they cannot get from anyone else! The reason everyone says “Just be yourself” is because it allows you to show them something they haven’t seen before. When you can make a person happy, show them a new world, excite them at every twist and turn and take them on the adventure called ‘life’ with you, then you will gain the love and respect of that person. Being yourself allows you to open up for them and like a book they have never read before they will be allowed to go on a journey they have never gone on before. But it allows allows them to love the real you, not this fake story you pretend to be. Trust me, no matter how good your cover story looks, sooner or later, if they go deep enough, they will find out the kind of book you really are. Besides being yourself just ask yourself what it is that most of us desire out of life. See it from their point of view, who would they want to fall in love with? Wouldn’t you say it is reasonable to assume that if you can give them love and happiness, the two things most people want most in their lives, that they will then treat you nicely in the very least? That being said, if you want to make someone fall in love with you you only need to give them those two things.   #1 - Unconditional love. Think about the people you love the most, when do they love you? For most of us these are our parents. We love our parents, just as they love us, and hardly anything can ruin that. My question is: Why? The reason for this is often because your parents will love you no matter what! If you have a great relationship with your parents it is most often because they did not care what you did, who you turned into or where you went in life, they still loved you. This undeniable, unending, unconditional support is something that you cannot push away. If you can love someone else without any conditions and show that to them, they will feel drawn to you. Not only will they be safe with you around but they will have an unquestionable source of love next to them. (P.S. For those of you in the friend-zone, the reason you are there is often because you give love that person unconditionally but will expect something more as soon as it turns into a relationship.)   #2 - Happiness. Almost every person, when asked, said that the thing they desire the most out of anything else is to be happy. We all know that making your partner happy is the essence of a good relationship, but let’s take a deeper look at that: How do you actually make someone happy? Rewind again to a time where the people around you were the happiest. And, when you think about that, you will realize the moment your parents were the happiest was when you were a child. When you did not go to school yet, but were old enough to at least be able to do the basic human functions on your own. When they took you to the playground, when you played tag running around the house and when you listened to the stories they read to you. That is the time most parents remember because you gave them so much joy. So what the heck did you do back then that made them so happy? Here’s where it gets a bit counterintuitive: The only thing you did was try to have fun. As a child your sole purpose is to have fun, to enjoy life and to do whatever you can to create a great mood. The whole reason you stood up in the morning, threw tantrums in the store and ran around screaming was to have fun. And if you think about it you will realize that you also had the most fun being around people that had a lot of fun themselves! Just look at comedians, for example, whose job is it to make others laugh. The most fun we have with a comedian is when they break character and start laughing about themselves! That’s why bloopers are so hilarious, why the “Funniest Home Videos” often create such a laugh and why you want to spend time around your happy, funny friends. If you can have a lot of fun being around a certain person and take them with you on that ride, letting them join in on the fun and making sure they are happy as well, then you will have someone that admires you at the very least.  Now, if you put those two desires of other people together and mix in a little bit of time and effort and sprinkle a lot of honesty in showing yourself into the concoction and then heat it to about 230°C for 25 minutes, you will have created yourself a Love Potion. Obviously, it may not be that easy all the time, but create that potion and you will be well over half-way there!  Stop being less than you can be and reach your goals. Send me a message saying "Coaching" to work 1 to 1 with me. Lukas Schwekendiek

We all want to be loved, and we want that love to be effortless. Perhaps, this is why people have long been romanced by the concept of a magic potion that perfectly patches people back together, igniting passion, liveliness, and love. When I was 12, I played in my school’s adaptation of A Midsummer Night’s Dream, a Shakespearean comedy that traces a collection of characters who are mistakenly placed under the spell of a passion-inducing flower. Comical conflict ensues as characters fall in and out of love, left and right. All ends well when the spell is reversed on everyone except for one man, who now conveniently loves a woman who desired him, but who he despised at the play’s start. Though I loved the play, I remember being slightly irked at this one outcome, that this particular love was inauthentic, that Shakespeare had cheated. In reality, we all want to be loved, but in order to have the love we say we want, we have to throw fantasy out the window. Love isn’t something that happens to us. It’s something we cultivate, something we can ignite within us by being open, vulnerable, and ourselves. According to many experts, what causes us to fall out of love has a lot to do with our tendency to protect ourselves by pushing back, losing sight of who we are as individuals, and forgoing real intimacy for a fantasy of connection. Staying in love has less to do with an unseen force pushing us toward or away from another and more to do with our own willingness to be open and vulnerable and to look at the behaviors that are steering us away from our closest feelings. This is good news, because it means we have a lot more power than we think when it comes to how we feel. As Dr. Lisa Firestone said, “Love involves behavior. It is a skill. To be truly loving, we have to take actual actions toward our partner that he or she experiences as loving.” So, while a potion would be nice, the answer to our woes is usually in our own actions. According to Dr. Firestone, there are ways to stay truly connected to our love for someone else, to help them feel seen, loved, and, therefore, more open and affectionate toward us. Here are some essential tips adapted from the work of Dr. Firestone and her father Dr. Robert Firestone, author of The Fantasy Bond. See the person for who he or she is. We can’t really feel loved unless we’re being seen. And we can’t express love unless we’re really seeing someone else. True love has to be true. To love someone, we have to know them. A famous study by Arthur Aron listed a series of personal questions that can produce intimacy and closeness between two otherwise strangers, leading some to say they make people fall in love. The 36 questions range from, “when did you last sing to yourself?” to “if you could change anything about the way you were raised, what would it be?” The conclusion of the study was that a “key pattern associated with the development of a close relationship is sustained, escalating, reciprocal, personal self-disclosure.” This was put a touch more romantically in the New York Times essay by Mandy Len Catron, which she wrote about how her and her now partner tried Aron’s questions before they started dating. “What I like about [Aron’s] study is how it assumes that love is an action,” Catron wrote. “I see now that the story isn’t about us [her and her partner]; it’s about what it means to bother to know someone, which is really a story about what it means to be known.” In order to keep love alive, we have to remain curious about the person we’re sharing our lives with without trying to fit them into something (or someone) else. Express affection. The more we express love physically and emotionally, the more we feel it. A Stonybrook University study concluded that intense love can last long-term, and that one of the main factors making this possible is the presence of physical affection like hugging and kissing. This is consistent with Bianca Acevedo’s research that states that lasting romantic love is possible and is characterized by three main factors: intensity, engagement, and sexual liveliness. Part of not letting love fade means connecting to it physically through touch, contact, and intimacy. Do things the other person will perceive as loving. As much as we may love another person, sometimes we become so wrapped up in our own feelings that we stop seeing the other person. We may do things that seem in the vein of being a “good husband, wife, boyfriend, or girlfriend,” but we aren’t necessarily tuning in to what our partner really wants from us. Throwing a huge birthday party may feel generous, but maybe our partner would prefer if we just slowed down and caught up. We should always aim to offer tenderness, compassion, and sensitivity to the needs of the other person. What expressions of love would make him or her uniquely happy? Support what lights the person up separately from yourself. When we first get together with someone, we typically appreciate and respect each other’s individuality. It’s what attracts us to each other, the unique qualities that make each of us who we are. At first, this expands our worlds, and we’re willing to go along for the ride, because we’re excited about this new person and what they’re adding to our lives. As we get closer, however, we sometimes start to limit each other, relating as a unit as opposed to two individuals. This can be a good thing in the sense of sharing more and feeling close, but when we start to control and restrict each other, the relationship tends to deaden and even create resentment. We should never give up being ourselves in a relationship nor should we ask someone else to give up themselves. This means we may have to stop trying to control the situation. We should strive to continue to offer concern and support for the loved one’s aspirations separate from our own. Love thrives when two individuals make a choice to be together to enrich their lives, not to limit them. Encourage the other person to see their friends and to do the activities that make them come alive. This is the only way to maintain our feelings of freedom and attraction. Share activities and pursuits both old and new. When we first get close to another person, we often share a bunch of new activities that make our lives feel fuller and more exciting. As we get more bogged down into routine, we may stop doing those things we once loved to share like cooking together, meeting up for coffee, or, as many couples report, having as much physical contact or sex. It’s important not to stop taking the time for the things that we once shared that connect us to our loving feelings. On the flip side of the same coin, it’s important not to just fall into habit and stop trying new things, both together and separately. Again, the idea is for our worlds to always be growing as a means of keeping ourselves feeling alive in the relationship. Engage in an ongoing, honest exchange of personal feelings. When we are open with another person, we allow them to truly know us. By being vulnerable and saying what we want and how we feel, we give our partner an opportunity to get close to us, to feel for us, and understand who we are. This isn’t about blaming or complaining. It’s about being an honest and equal adult expressing what we feel and think directly, without manipulation. At the same time, we should be open to the other person’s feedback and to hearing how he or she feels and what bothers him or her. We can meet this communication with compassion, both for our partner and for ourselves, so that we don’t react defensively and both feel closer from the contact. Be wary of your inner critic. We all have a critical inner voice that puts us and our partner down. It’s like an internal enemy we harbor that just doesn’t believe we’re lovable and sneakily works to push love away. This inner critic offers terrible relationship advice, encouraging us to engage in hurtful or dismissive behavior, telling us to hate, pity, or protect ourselves in ways that don’t allow other people to truly be close to us. Getting to know this inner critic is a key part of allowing ourselves to fall in love long-term, because if we listened to this “voice,” most of us would wind up alone. While there is no single secret, no potion we can conjure up, to make love last, holding these practices as principle gives us the best chance of having real love in our lives for as long as possible. This kind of love is richer than fantasy and more rewarding than mere loyalty. It keeps us invigorated and excited about the possibilities of a given day. When taken to heart, these steps keep us more than just in love, but alive, and not just to our partner but within ourselves.

Well… nope. Let’s look back at me in my younger years and see what we have. What I see is an introverted little kid who doesn’t know what to do. What to say when someone complimented him, what to do to get what he wanted, how to express his love for someone. You should know better than to expect him to do something like “make someone fall in love with him”. Really, I was a fool, honestly. There was this one girl I really loved, and let’s not get into the details, but she left in the end, and she was right; it was my fault, mostly. I was naive. I didn’t know how to interact with people, and this is it. But I would like to thank her, for she is one reason I became a better person in this aspect. I learned a lot, I’m no longer an introvert and I know what to do. I’m still cautious when it comes to meeting new people, and some people may still find my personality off-putting (At least that’s how I feel) but overall I’m much better socially. This change might have come, eventually, even without her. But still, she is a reason. Now, I’d like to go back to your question. It is still a no. I learned many things, but making someone love me isn’t one of them, and I don’t need to learn how. If someone loves me, be it a friend, relative, or whoever they may be, I want them to love me for who I am. One major plus of being unable to make someone love me is that whoever loves me, loves me because they want to (Whatever you’d like to call it), not because I made them. They will not be easily disappointed and if they ever be, they will stay for a while longer. Anyone to disagree here? Some people, friends among others, have accepted me for who I was, and we still are friends today, that is a plus. So no, I cannot and rather not make anyone love me.

People fall in love with our energy.  We tend to look for someone to give us love rather than learning to love ourselves first. When we don’t love ourselves it’s much more difficult to find someone else to share our energy with. This is because instead of being the energy people want to receive it’s quite the opposite. This kind of energy repels the good energy from us. 1)Love Yourself By loving yourself openly, you’re inviting someone else to love you openly as well. It’s not easy loving yourself but if you can’t then don’t expect someone else to, that’s selfish. Be yourself & the universe will bring you along someone to grow with. Be aware of negative thoughts and emotions because they’re unhealthy for your personal development. Negative emotions & self-talk can be projected on to other people if you’re not conscious of it. You’ll be perceived as pessimistic, jealous & insecure. These characteristics do not attract good energy to you is crucial to your positive improvement. 2)Have goals By having goals for each area of your life you become organized & gain clarity on where you want to go. It’s easier for people to grow in love with you when you have a plan for your life. It’s reassurance to the other person that you’re willing to be disciplined about your goals & outcome of your life. You seem much more stable & give off the impression of being able to take care of yourself. Sometimes our partners need guidance in setting up goals for themselves & we can help them do that. We also sometimes fall off track ourselves & when someone holds us accountable it becomes more of a priority. 3)Develop self-awareness It’s important to have a strongly developed self-awareness when you are in or getting into a relationship. You have the ability to determine why you feel angry, frustrated, sad, or anxious. When you have a strong self-awareness you’re able to steer your thoughts wherever you want them to go. Despite the situation or challenge we face, strong self-awareness helps you overcome them. This kind of clarity allows you to really understand what kind of life you want with your partner. You can set goals with each other & cultivate different ways to grow together. It’s important to make progress together because if you don't, then you’ll begin to get frustrated with yourself. 4)Eliminate insecurities This was most difficult for me because I used to be scared of losing the person I was in love with. I was afraid of being hurt & vulnerable so as soon as I felt threatened, I’d withdraw and get upset. My mind would start thinking about worst possible outcomes. Sometimes, I still get jealous but it’s something I’ve gotten so much better at & improving on daily. I’ve realized that there’s no reason for being jealous because it only makes you more upset & it’s embarassing. You literally make up lies in your head to prove yourself right. Even if worst case scenario has happened to you before, realize that there is a lesson behind everything that happens to us. Life does not happen to you, it happens for you and therefore must not be afraid to love. Being insecure blocks us from the ability to fully love ourselves and others. Remember… Most of the negative assumptions we create in our minds don’t happen in the first place. Being the jealous person in the relationship can be a very negative experience for you & the other person. When both of you are that way it can be destructive. You will begin to question eachother’s trust & this can create unwanted tension between the two of you, even before a relationship is established. It’s essential to increase your self-awareness to understand what you really want in a relationship & in life.  Thank you for reading! Follow me here on Quora for more self improvement tips :)

Stop Trying - Stop trying so hard to make someone love you. In my experience, I’ve been unsuccessful with love when I was actively trying to make it happen. You find love when you live and act like someone who isn’t desperate for it. I think people are attracted to people who seemingly don’t need them because “we all want what we can’t have”. You can’t force someone to love you, so don’t worry too much about it. This leads into my next point… Live An Attractive Lifestyle – Live a life that someone would want to be a part of. Part of falling in love in my opinion is not just falling in love with another person, but falling in love with their lifestyle too. After all, if you’re going to spend a lot of time with someone, you might as well have fun while you’re doing it! Focus on yourself and work towards setting up the life you want to live. Work out, eat better, make strides in your career, travel, etc. Play Cat And Mouse – I think part of the fun in building the initial attraction with someone is the uncertainty of it all. Have you ever wanted to chase after someone and became less interested when they made themselves too available for you? You want the other person to feel like they “caught a big fish” when you’re together. You want them to feel like they found something valuable and they would never want to give it up. So in my opinion, express your interest in another person, but don’t make yourself too available. It’s like a balancing act. Expressing too much interest could make you appear needy and being too unavailable makes you appear aloof. Make Them Invest In You – You’re more likely to fall in love with someone you’re more invested in. The more time, money, emotional energy, and other resources someone spends on you, the more attached they become. Grow Together – When you’re with someone, it’s important to evolve together. Look at a relationship like a roller coaster. What makes the roller coaster fun and addictive are the ups and downs and unexpected turns along the way. In a relationship love grows stronger when you build a number of diverse experiences with each other. Spend time together, go on trips, love each other, hate each other, love again, and become more deeply connected… Top 3 Life Lessons - Here is a bonus YouTube video I made describing the top 3 lessons I’ve learned so far in life. I post videos every week so feel free to subscribe for more life changing content. After watching, I’d like to know from you, What is the biggest lesson you’ve learned so far in life? Be yourself. It sounds insanely cliche and meaningless in this day and age, but there's more to it. When you “are yourself,” it doesn't have to mean that you just go around saying and doing the same things you always have. Instead, you should be bold, but never rude. There is a girl at my school that I consider to be the most “real” person that I have met in the high school. I'm going to call her Lucy to protect her identity. Lucy is the funniest girl that I have ever met, but she's also the most honest. She never fails to make a joke or say something if she sees someone wearing a shirt of something she likes. In eight grade, she admitted that she liked anime. It may not seem like much, but when you have people like me who spent my middle school years dealing with severe anxiety, hearing someone admit they like something that's not necessarily “cool” is a big deal. Lucy's one of those people that even though I don't know her that well, I consider her a friend. I would turn to her if I ever got into trouble, because I feel like I know her. She is completely, 100% percent herself. She is raw, and she is bold. You need to be bold. Tell that girl that she looks cute today. Tell that guy that he's really hot and him working out is really noticeable. Live your life with the philosophy that of you notice it, say something. You never know who may be too afraid to say anything. Unless, of course, it's rude. Then you should simply keep your mouth quiet. People gravitate to those who are simply raw. Even if the person you've been crushing on for months doesn't like you, there will be more people who like him. People already love you and like you, you just haven't seen it yet. Don't give up. Life hasn't given up on you yet. Sincerely, A Girl Who Refuses to Give Up on You

Stop trying to control them into loving you. The general populace is too busy living their own lives to acknowledge your existence, let alone decide whether they “love” you or not. And if you do all sorts of things to gain their favor, they could still treat you like dirt. We are each the center of our own world, and that doesn’t change no matter what you do to get attention- solve hunger, cure cancer or shoot up a school, it makes little difference. There are nice ones and mean ones, we feel unloved around mean ones even though their meanness may have nothing to do with us! And we feel loved around a nice person even though they’re just being polite sometimes. So don’t try. Change your perspective of love. It’s not your problem to “make” anyone love or even like you, but it is your problem to act with love and recognize the few who appreciate you.

There are some "tricks", some of them work so well that they shouldn't be told any further. But I will embed them in a few tips that should also be considered in any long term relationship: We fall in love with people who we feel have a special relationship with us. This feeling can be encouraged:Show real interest. Really listen, think about it, and ask questions out of the desire to understand the other.Maintain eye contact, often and for a long time. This makes it clear that the other person is the focus of your attention.Make physical contact: a hug for a greeting; a hand contact during the conversation to underline emotions ("I'm so happy for you!", "No, did he really say that?" - all opportunities for brief contact.)Take your time: always be there when you are needed, but don't obtrude.Always be helpful and friendly. Contrary to popular belief, we fall in love with nice people more often.Be persistent. Anyone looking for quick successes does not deserve them.Be tolerant and patient. Be yourself, but also adapt in specific things when necessary. This may not be that important if the only goal is to make the other person fall in love with you. But if you want to keep lasting love afterwards, you need a lot of patience and tolerance.

You can't make one specific person love you. George Clooney is taken now. I can't get him to love me.  Ditto for Steve Black. What I can do, is find somebody who will love me. I do this by loving myself first.  When I accept and even love my foibles, when I take good care of myself, when I'm true to my values and desires, and think of myself as a prize, I make room for others can do the same. If I try to make somebody love me by taking care of them unilaterally, fixing them, or solving their dilemmas, I end up with a son and not getting much in return. If I try to make somebody love me by being helpless and needy, I end up with a daddy and not feeling very good about myself.   If I try to make somebody love me by demanding it, I end up with skid marks in my driveway. It's the best news and the worst news.  It's the worst news because you will have to face your stuff, and be responsible for your own happiness, but it's the best news because nobody will ever be able to take that away from you.  You will have a good life regardless of whether there is a man or woman in it, and you will have the best chance at a satisfying relationship.  So go make yourself look good, go out and do something you enjoy, and have fun just for the heck of it.  Try it and see what comes back to you.
