The answer to this question is quite simple: Be yourself, be honest, Exude Love (without being aloof). Since my Answer would likely be rejected if I were to hit SUBMIT, let me explain these aforementioned characteristics. 1) Be Yourself Not only is this the First thing that came to mind, but it is truly the top energy you can resonate. You’ll attract guys whom resonate with that frequency. Of course, if you’re not attracting the guys you think you should have, then you should readjust your energy. Many times, the reality is that we attract those we don’t want because we’re not being who we want to be. Being Human alone is an awesome experience…being Sentient, yet another awesome factor. Sentient: having the power of perception by the senses; conscious. Unfortunately, we are forced to waste our learning years on learning things that are not relevant to us (purposeful design by those who steer the system). Thus, we have to learn our senses in a less impressionable state. This is partially why you see so many younger adults still figuring out that their “private” parts are “private” for a reason… With all of this madness, how do you be yourself? Well…you must learn what it means to Love yourself. I literally just learned how to do that. Of course, was I not being who I am, I may not have had the opportunity to encounter that small, powerful message. We all say that we Love ourselves…but do we really know what that means? This is what people mean when they say that you have to learn what you like and the like…but what they’re actually saying is, “Learn how to Love yourself.” Of you’re thinking it means “being more selfish,’ you are wrong…not that it means “be more selfless.” Perhaps it means whatever you want it to mean initially, but in the end, it means to take care of yourself as you would another…who fell in love with you. Be gracious, kind, empathetic, and with boundaries. Those boundaries are arbitrary, of course, until you’re comfortable enough with who you are, who you were, and who you’ll become. Begin that journey, cut off the television constantly influencing and controlling you, reduce your internet usage (especially YouTube and other media distribution services), and just be. All of the major belief systems have moments of solitude as the most reassuring. There is a reason for this. 2) Be Honest Whether you’re religious or not, you’ve come across the idea that “Faith can move a mountain.” Perhaps, having the “faith of a child” has crossed your path? Faith…means “honesty.” Sure, it has alternate meanings (some relevant, others to fill an agenda), but in the end, “Honest” is the definition that resonates most with my Center Chakra. Some times I think back and wonder whether or not my Honesty has pushed away opportunities that I could’ve otherwise lead to fruitful endeavors, but the fruit of honesty is beyond anything I’ve seen — thus, I remain honest. With that being said, realize that you live in a dishonest environment. You must not seek delivering honesty to the point of causing another immeasurable harm, but many times, honesty will get you — for lack of a better term — exiled from many gatherings…primarily because you’re not just “telling others how you see it —” any of us can do that. It always tickles me when I see people claim they’re honest because they have an opinion of which they express. This occurs primarily with Women with some level of repressed anger whom feel it their duty to make everyone pay for the transgressions of their past. My heart goes out to them, as not only do they misunderstand the difference between honesty and ignorance, they misunderstand their roles as Women and wonder why they’ve either found no Man who does what he “should” or they find a Man who does the exant opposite of what they expected in a relationship. I am quite hard on Women, because you guys hold all of the cards in everything, but still find it necessary to blame a Man when things go South. It doesn’t make sense. This is why we don’t have communities and the like… So don’t be like that. Be yourself. Be Honest…especially with yourself. Learn the difference between intuition, anxiety, and fear…and you’ll have 75% of the game. Your next lover will thank you for it. Note: I realize that this has turned into an answer about attracting a suitable partner…but this is far more desirable than having Love at First Site. “Love at First Site” is normally closer to “Lust at First Site”…and that has its place as well. If you’re just looking for a date, I can privately share my OkCupid Profile with you and we can go from there… I’ll fall in love with you…just for being a Woman (hence: my first two advisements). Most Men set “Feminine Woman” as their bar to entry. Unfortunately, in American society, this is an elusive, valuable group. #message ^^^Yes, that’s a hashtag in a formal prose; I do what I want^^^ Lastly, 3) Exude Love. The old adage that opposites attract has its merit, but I strongly believe it is not properly represented in greater society. At this point, we’ve arrived at a junction where “Love” is bought and the effects are “hardly.” After the previous two objectives have been truly embraced by you, this third one is a no-brainer. I am moreso sharing a third advisement because once you reach this point, I don’t believe there will be any problem exuding Love (because you Love yourself for being yourself), but take this more as the encouragement to exude Love. Oh yeah, plus points feel better made with the Power (not mathematical notation…just “Power”) of 3. 3 is a lovely number… The world seems kind of harsh — very harsh — but the affliction paints the Western World far more horrendously than other parts (at this time). Regardless, it remains that Love is the most Powerful force in the Universe. I believe we are seeing that occur right now before our eyes… … What I would like you to take from this list of advisements (short, but succinct) is that there are Men ready and willing to be the receiver of your objectivity…or, said more conventionally, would love for you to be the object of their desire. I haven’t even seen a picture of you, but believe that if you stay in this zone of wonderment and study, you’ll find yourself in far more situations that you want to be in, as opposed to those that you’ve acquiesced to. Be well, Sibling. And never forget to keep questioning, learning, and growing. Many times, it is the “Growth” that scares us most. Even with that said, I can say that I went through a phase here recently where I did everything but what I knew I should do in an effort to avoid certain discomforts. In the end, I still had to deal with the discomforts… So, don’t be afraid to Grow. And yeah, that makes it four thoughts on having someone fall in Love with you, but I see the Fourth more as a Personal strategy for improvement than specifically being used to attract someone’s affection. Any questions…or further inquiries: Feel free. With Love

By healing the place that led you to ask this question. True love will come when you find someone who is compatible with you, who you want to love and who you sincerely care about, and who feels the same towards you. Heal your wounds, and explore your true needs and true self. Own that and honour that. Resolve the need to be liked or “loved” by everyone. It is quite easy to make the most of one’s appearance and develop some sort of charisma. But the charm that you may have over a handful of people will not be love. No one will be in love with you. They may feel intrigue, they may feel infatuation or some sort of attraction for you if you master social skills and are conventionally attractive. But whatever you perceive as people “being in love with you”, will be a projection of your own fantasy and insecurity. No one will be in love with you. It may offer a false sense of security and status. But it will not be real love. Heal yourself. Know what you want and what you have to offer. Cultivate authenticity, which will allow you to connect with people who can actually see you, and thus actually love “you”. Not just have a fleeting infatuation with a facade. Trust me, it is much more fulfilling to have quality connections rather than live in a state of delusion where you mistake infatuation and intrigue with being “in love”. To briefly share a story- an ex of mine was a multi-millionaire. He was very handsome and dressed well. He had swag and confidence. He was entitled and shameless and that was so sexy and intriguing. But I never loved him. He was just an enigmatic person. I learned a lot about confidence and shamelessness from him- but he was hollow. He was just a shell of a man who was charming and intriguing, but who totally lacked depth or the capacity to connect with people on any real level. At one point I thought I was in love with him, but he was just enigmatic and confused me- so I stuck along for the ride until I quickly figured him out. Shortly after meeting him I realized what a boring shell of a person he was, and lost all the intrigue and chemical pull that I felt towards him. The only men I have enduring love for are those who are sincere, vulnerable, authentic, and in touch with reality. The infatuation you feel for celebrities or crushes is fleeting and shallow. If you decide to try and master that swag and charm, that is what people may feel towards you. But don’t mistake that for love.

I know everyone will tell you to “be yourself” but here’s the thing: that only works if you know who you are, and you’re comfortable with yourself. Telling you to “be yourself” is probably not very helpful, since if you knew how to do that, you wouldn’t be asking this. So my advice is to first, figure out who you are and who you want to be. Then be that person. Focus on what you like, and why you like those things. Ask yourself: What do you like about yourself? What makes you interesting? Answer for yourself, and then ask your friends and family. What do they like about you, what do they think is interesting about you? If you like what the answers to these questions are, then develop them further. Find ways to go deeper into the hobbies and interests that you like. Do more of the things you enjoy. If you don’t like the answers, then start changing your behavior. For example, if you don’t like that you’re quiet, look up articles about good conversation topics and practice talking more. You can change who you are, but it requires learning new things and practicing them.  Now back to your question. You can hope that who you want to be is someone who this attractive person will want to date, and fall in love with. But here’s the thing, if that attractive person doesn’t want to fall in love with who you want to be, then why bother? Find people who like the person you want to be, and you’ll find people who will fall for you.

What you have here can be viewed as a marketing problem. Your ex realized you (as a product) didn't fit in her life. We don't know the details, we just know that she was unhappy, and scrapped the relationship.  If you are the factory owner, how do you win back customers? You improve your product!  Of course this is the best all around approach, as it increases your marketability. It makes you more confident and prouder of your product. You have positive word of mouth, instead of complaints.  No matter how you improve yourself (the product), you will have to accept that there will always be customers that cannot be lured back. The bad taste from their experience with your product cannot be overcome. This is an outcome of presenting a product not yet ready for market - while you gain valuable on-the-ground experience in real time, dissatisfied product users often cannot be won back.  Tl;DR Work on yourself. Become the best you possible. You'll achieve two benefits from this approach. First, you're committed to quality, and know that you're doing your best. Secondly, if the ex doesn't recognize your efforts, or just doesn't want to get back together, there will be plenty of other opportunities with new women.

Well, there are several things you can do that will increase your chances of anyone loving you - Love yourself, take care of your self, be confident in your actions, be presentable, etc. However, people have free will - They don’t have to love you, nor would you likely be happy with the outcome if you could force someone to love you. Sometimes folks have this idea, that if only this one loved me, how great would I feel? This is rather one-sided. And love is more than butterflies in your stomach or the pitter-patter of your heart beating in your chest. Ultimately, I believe love is a verb - it’s an action. Unexpressed in action and speech, it’s simply a hormonal reaction trapped within you, for none to see. In this regard, do loving things, but most of all, be lovable! Whereas all this can increase your chances, ultimately it is up to the other person, as it should be. Love freely given is priceless, and will outshine any love you might obtain in exchange of power, money, status, etc. Besides, you would like the other to love your authentic self. You might fool them for a short while, but your true self will be revealed. If you are deficient in certain areas (bad/short temper, addictions, etc.), then work on your self to be the best you that you can be - And be loveable. Good luck!

If you're eating heart-shaped chocolates alone in a bathrobe this Tuesday, don't worry: Society doesn't get to tell you the right way to celebrate the life of a martyred third-century Catholic saint - and also, love and attraction are weird and mysterious things. There's a lot we don't understand about love - to the degree that we're even sure it exists as a meaningful psychological state outside of social constructs. And there's a lot that's idiosyncratic to individual people and couples. That's why a lot of research into why we mate is bizarre to the point of incoherence - cultural norms as well as oddities in research methods can create a lot of noise. Yet it turns out there is a lot of science about why people fall in love that is at once super strange and actually fairly credible. Keep in mind that no one study is enough to draw definite, broad conclusions. That's especially true because this research tends to focus on the specific behaviors of heterosexual undergraduate students at the universities where researchers work. Still, there's a lot of fascinating knowledge out there about our habits of love and attraction. Visit here for more details : Can Science help in making Someone Fall in Love with you? And don’t do it for them either. That will freak them out. This person’s doing good things… but like not staring at me right after to get my validation. Short answer is, just because you love someone, you can’t make anyone love you. But loving yourself and being yourself is how you really tell when someone loves you. It depends whether you want this relationship to be lasted for a long time or not. If you just want the other person to fall in love with you and you really don't care about the duration of your relationship, 1. Never show the other person that you're way too much interested in them. 2. Don't be so desperate about getting their attention towards you. This strongly repels the other person, most of the times. 3. Find if he/she is Single and looking for a relationship. 4. Find out what they like/dislike to do. 5. Create a scene on your head a day before you meet the other person. (Hint: make use of the results from point 4) 6. Try to execute the scene. Chances are huge that it won't go well as you planned. Don't give up. Keep repeating. 7. Make his/her hobbies as yours. In short, Force yourself to be someone who your partner will fall in love with. (But, for how long can you do it?!! :D ) Whereas, If you expect a possibly "forever" relationship, 1. Meet the other person and confront that you're interested in them. Note: Don't say that you love them. Love is a big word and we use it at inappropriate situations. 2. Ask for a dinner date to know each other better in the most polite way that you can ask. 3. Be yourself all the time. They may fall in love for who you're. Looks simple and a lot easier, isn't it?

Love is one of those things that can be really hard to understand we can try to explain it with science but there will always be a magical aspect to romance and yet when it comes to attraction there are some interesting psychological proven dating tips or facts that might just prove useful when you’re looking for that special someone. Here are 14 proven dating tips to make someone fall in love with you.  1. First Impressions First things first and yes we’re talking about first impressions studies have shown that you only have about 30 seconds to make an impression on someone that’s the amount of time it takes for someone to decide whether they like you or not. 2. Availability What’s the most attractive trait surprisingly research has shown that it’s not physical beauty status or even personality its availability this basically means that in order to be attractive you have to let people know you’re single or at least throw some pretty strong hints out there. 3. Mere-Exposure Ever felt like you’re falling more and more in love with someone the more time you spend with them that’s the magic of the mere-exposure effect research has found that those who spend more time with each other are statistically more likely to find each other attractive. 4. Chameleon effect People seem to be attracted to those who act just like they do they say opposites attract but the opposite is also true at least according to the chameleon effect this states that if you subtly copy people’s body language and mannerisms they’re more likely to find you attractive. . Have you ever seen people, who fell in love for the first time and took the relationship lifelong till the end? . I've seen plenty of them. How do you think they pulled it off, when they had no experience with Relationships before? . I've observed a common trait among these people. . They both were never looking for a Relationship in the first place: When you are actively looking for a relationship, you'll be in a hurry to try out with whoever you have even a remotest compatibility or attraction towards. Like trying out 100 Shoes before settling for one. . But when you're not actively looking for a Relationship and focusing on something permanent such as a Career, You're essentially keeping Romance as a second priority. Hence, you are calmer and you feel you have a lot of time to get to the right person. . When you are calm, you are not desparate and most likely will calculate and settle for a relationship, that gives you a lot of space to grow and make you intrinsically happy. . They have good amount of Communication, Inter-personal and Emphatic skills: A lot of people believe, you need flirting skills and some theory like Law Of Attraction, to get to the right person. . While it may work for a few people, Essentially your basic interpersonal skills that often gets you more friends, are more than enough for you to find your True love. . Care, Maturity, Affection, Understanding and Little bit of Attraction - These skills will help you get a lot of friends as well as get you close to your true love. . They were confident in their respective Careers: These people knew what they were doing and what they need to do to step up their career ladder. Though you need not show potential for making 6 figure salary per month, If a person notices that you are confident and hard working enough to steadily rise in your career over-time, your chances of a successful relationship, increases. . Think of it! Not dying for a relationship + Basic Interpersonal skills + Confidence + Steady career. A combination of the above will easily remove the bridge between you and your true love.  Nothing fancy like Law Of attraction required. Nothing complicated like Flirting skills needed. Particularly, no need to spend hours at GYM or Beauty Parlor, just to get the first love of your life.

You don't say if you are still together or re connecting after many years. If you are still together and you feel the fire has died then go back to the beginning. Start dating her all over again, this is what happens to so many couples. Mince they settle in with each other they forget the things that brought them together and made them feel such passion, Its like taking mom’s recipe and leaving out essential ingredients then wondering why it isn't as good as it was when she made it. Dating is a life long part of keeping your relationship alive and healthy. And make sure you keep your phones in your pockets. Talk to each other. Be interested in their lives and what they are doing. Try buying her flowers on days when there is no expectation. Surprise her with a simple well thought out gift. A gift that will have some emotional significance. You have to re ignite those embers that are still burning but ready to die out. If you don't, someone will come along that will and you will be history. If you have been apart for some time and If those feelings were powerful and real, it it hard to resurrect them years later. I have seen it many times with people I know who run into their first love years later, their circumstances have changed and they are now single and then come into contact with their first love one way or the other. In a brief time all those feelings come back and curiosity takes over, “hmm, what if”. Soon they go for coffee, then dinner then they are back together before you know it. But if it was a casual relationship lacking in true love then don't expect much. But interestingly, these nostalgic relationships seek to work once they re-develop and they go on to live happy un destructed lives. I was fortunate enough to marry the one and only love of my life. We met when we were I. 7th grade, started dating when 16 and we have stayed together ever since. We did spread our wings when we graduated and tested the waters for awhile but neither of us was happy and we migrated right back together and got married in 1968. I have often said, “I'm glad we married because If I had married another I would have spent my whole life wondering what if?” I know I would have had her in my mind forever. So I avoided the self torture and stayed with the sure thing. I have never regretted it. I hope it works for you like it has for so many others. But don't rush into anything. Many years apart produces a lot of baggage you might not be prepared for. Don't be blinded by love some things are deal breakers and you have to be realistic in your ability to deal with those things. I would start by just taking it slow with little simple coffee, lunch dates, then dinner. Do some things you both enjoyed when you were dating. It will stir her memories and emotions. But don't appear needy. Take it slow, or you might just push her away. Women need time to process things and ponder over what's happening and how they feel. Rushing them is a turn off.

But you can try.

Simply put, you can’t. Many times we can’t even control how we feel, much less how others feel. The reality is how others feel is very much out of our locus of control. What is within our control though is whether we give ourselves the best possible chance of having someone fall in love with us. This starts with accepting the burden of being loved. When you’re loved by others, your actions have consequences to their emotions and wellbeing. Are you ready to take on that responsibility? The idea of somebody endlessly taking care of our wants and needs, while great, isn’t love. Love is a two way street where two people find joy in giving to each other and create a life that is more than the sum of its parts. Where you can care about another person’s emotions as much as your own. Because to truly be loved, you must be able to love… And if you have to ask how can I make others fall in love with me…then you’re not ready for it.

Just go with the unconditional love bit and hope you get it right!

Define “Make”. If you take it as meaning “Force”, or mean some infallible thing you can do, even without their cooperation, that will always result in the other person falling in love with you, then the answer is, “No”. However, if you interpret more like “Influence”, then of course. There are books aplenty, videos, blogs, and studies to show that absolutely you can do things to increase the chances (maybe even to near-certainty) that someone will fall in love with you. I think I would add that the chances diminish over time. I mean that there is a peak of opportunity when you first meet someone, but if you fail to succeed in those first moments, your chances fall off asymptotically. I’m also not certain that ANYONE could pull of such a stunt. I think a certain degree of personal confidence, appearance, etc will factor into the likelihood of success.

You can’t. You can’t make someone love you. You’ll find a million books and cutesy “psychological” articles that claim that they can help you make someone love you, but the truth is that you can’t. Hi, I'd recommend this TED talk by Mandy Len Catron, titled: Falling in love is the easy part In it she reveals a 36-question 'exercise,' including 4 minutes of sustained eye contact at the end.  The questions can be summed up as escalating, reciprocal, personal self-disclosure. Mandy has tested the tool, and claims that if a couple both agree to go through it together, they stand an excellent chance they will fall in love.  She and her current partner fell in love that way over a year ago. However, as suggested by the title of her talk, it's only the beginning. A couple of her observations are: -   Everyone wants to be loved: to be known, to be seen and to be understood.-   Love doesn't just happen to us.  We're in love because we each made the choice to be. Mandy then raises poignant questions, about the vulnerability you feel when you make that choice, as in 'what happens if one person or the other backs out?' -   How do you decide who deserves your love, and who does not?-   How do you stay in love when things get difficult?-   How do you know when to just cut and run?-   How do you live with the doubt that inevitably creeps into every relationship?-   How do you live with your partner's doubt? Hope all this gives you a bit better idea of what it takes to fall in love and sustain a love relationship.  Warmly ... Michael

You cannot force them to love you. They should feel attracted to you. But, your care and love is the first step for you to show them that you like them very much. That may make them feel attracted to you. If they do not, move on. But, continue to show care and love. In short, be like a symbol of love without holding any grudge or harbouring any hatred for anyone. Remember, the world is full of people who are willing to reciprocate your love if you are patient and look for them without any animosity in your heart for those who refuse to love you in return. Soon, you may find yourself difficult to decide when flooded with choices!

Nothing. You can't make another person love you, period. All you can do is be a loving person, and hope that they love you back. Love has a mind of its own. You can't control who you love. Feel their problems, share your own.Make them laugh. Bring happiness in everybody's life you meet or talk.Love them unconditionally, believe in true love. Be prepared to get heart broken.Tell them how you feel. Live with the decision.Well! : You may just started all this coz you liked and it was all planned, maybe this is too much artificial, but you don't hurt anybody this way. ₹@v!

I've expressed this before, you can't make someone love you. What you can do is be your authentic self and show the person you're interested in, that self. You can be supportive and help motivate the person you desire to show them you will be there for them in the ways they need, not in vain though. Don't expect anything in return either because when you expect something, you're only being/acting a certain way to gain something for YOUR own happiness. Hope this helps.

Honestly - I'd just be myself. I don't want someone to fall in love with an "image" of me that I present to him for a short time and then when he develops some unrealistic expectations from me, I change. That's why I never believe in showy relationships - where a couple might pretend to be in love, in front of the world but in reality they're pissed off and sick of each other because they both have broken each other's expectations and subsequently, each other's hearts…

Life is a little more complicated than that. To fall in love with someone, I think the best way is to first find out their values in life. If you both have the same values you are with someone who, if you also have the desire, to begin to date. Love will then either come or not. It doesn't mean you must have the same vaue system with everything. If he believes in god but you don't and hes good with that and so are you, then fine. It's when a persons value system is up against someone who believe in the opposite that partnerships crack. Much of what is called love, is in fact infatuation. Don't get them confused.

You cannot force love. Love is a decision people make based on many things. Forcing someone to love you is not real, it will not last, it will cause resentment. It it does not begin naturally and grow in each person it is not real. Not everyone will love everyone. Work on being a loving, caring person who is taking care of yourself and that is who you will attract into your life.

Being of value to people you want to attract is important, but there is a life-important issue here that you may want to address *first*. Your life will probably be riddled with disappointments if you think in terms of “making” or controlling other people to do things. Attempting to control other people is a form of disrespect — you wouldn’t want people doing that to you, would you? So my advice would be to lose the need to control, be yourself, be less narcissistic, have empathy for others, make yourself interesting; and you will be more likely to attract a mate who is a good match for you. If you absolutely are driven to control (as a psychopath or sociopath would be), then please don’t damage other peoples’ lives. You might consider a profession like being a Navy seal, cop, lawyer, or CEO (if you can make the grade).

You can't “make” someone fall in love with you. It's a matter of chemistry, pheremones, and mutual interests. What you CAN do is make YOURSELF lovable by going within yourself, knowing yourself, being honest with yourself about who you are, what you are, what you believe in, and what you are interested in. Develop your own skills and interests. Then seek out social settings where people with those interests gather. Allow serendipity to occur and love will manifest itself.

You cannot make someone love you. Eventually you'll meet someone and they will love you for who you are not just your looks. You have to just take time enjoy being single but also look forward that one person who will make you happy. Love happens in unexpected times if you keep wishing and hoping you'll find someone who will love you for who you are you may not find them at that time. But once you stop thinking about it they'll probably show up and you will fall in love it's the story of how the world works. Just know you will be loved.

You don't. Love cannot be forced. If you are the type of person somebody is interested in, then they will love you. It is possible, although foolhardy, to mold yourself into a person that someone will like. However, this will probably lead to a relationship in which you cannot be yourself because you are so afraid that you will be rejected if hyour partner sees your true self. The best thing you cann do is wait and be you. Before you know it, along will come someone who loves you just as you are. Good luck.

Just be yourself. If they love you, they love you. If they don’t, they don’t. Focus on yourself, take care of your garden, and butterflies will visit. You love someone because they trigger something inside you, you see something/ some problems of you in them, and you find they are attractive, but they might not mean to connect with you on a romantic relationship level. Don’t run after anybody, be that person for yourself, be a boyfriend/girlfriend for yourself, and the right people will come. I hope you can see what lesson you need to learn in this crush.

make people fall in love? “make”… I don’t know but it is love if You need to make them fall in love with you? Then it’s one sided love , yours or your targets that you maked to love you… Humans are not puppets You can’t make someone love you you can only hope they will love you for who you are and what good things you did for them… This kind of making love reminds rather of creating false emotions and feeling and not gaining real respect and trust.
response.upvotes: Answer requested by Umbert De Paris

response.answer_text: First impression should be good impression. So groom well. Inculcate good manners. Be confident. Maintain good body language. Get to know each other through meaningful conversations. Make eye contact and keep it as long as you can during the conversation. Create a sense of trust in a relationship. Demonstrate that you are trustworthy through both your words and your actions. Keep the other person around by expressing your appreciation on a regular basis, and offering up your gratitude. If you show interest in the other person’s activities, the other person feels good. If you want to hang out with someone, you need to open up. If you have a connection with someone, you should keep that connection alive. Ask other person for a favor here and there, even if it is a small thing, and the other person feels satisfied with helping you out. People like the passionate people because passion mixes with drive and ends up with accomplishment. So, be passionate about something.

You don’t have to make “everyone” like you. Most importantly though - be yourself, be kind, be compassionate, have a good sense of humor, be supportive, be interested in other people by asking questions, be positive, be upbeat. I recommend a hugely popular book: How to Win Friends and Influence People: Dale Carnegie Check it out! Lots of golden nuggets of info. And just the fact that you’re asking this question and showing you care, says great things about your character :)

You wanna know my secret? Well, I have a secret potion which I prepared on Halloween last year. When my crush came to my birthday party, I poured that potion into his drink. Now 6 months later, he’s in love with me. It’s a tried and tested thing! A 10/10 recommend!! Jokes apart, you seriously cannot ‘make’ someone fall in love with you. Just be yourself and let destiny take it’s course. If it’s meant to be, it’ll be! :) Adios! :)

If you want people to fall in love with you then the first thing you need to do is build a relationship of trust and confidence with them people will come to you. You need to make your presence felt everywhete. You should work hard in your office you so that people see your hard work and they start liking you and your work. Also remember one fact that you should never break the trust of the person who starts loving you because if you do that then that will be the end of the relationship and people will start hating you

Why would you want to rob yourself of the pleasure of knowing that people chose to love you and instead that you made them do it? No you cannot make people love you, it’s their decision and they should be making it. What can you do about it? Be good, focus on your goals, ask the guy/girl out, see if their frequencies match with you, if it does, congratulations. If not, focus on your goals and move on to next potential partner. Life is full of opportunities and people to meet.

It depends upon circumstances. Some may appreciate what you’re doing to make someone fall in love with you and will learn to love you eventually while others may fall in love with you without doing anything. No matter how much effort we do for someone if he/she is not really into you, it will be very hard for them to notice you. One thing I’ve learned was, you can’t never force someone to love you but you can always do everything for the one you love.

The best way to make someone fall for you, is to be yourself. The other thing I like to do since entering the dating arena again, is educate myself on understanding men better. I would recommend this also for anyone who is interested in dating. Educate yourself on people in general, reading books, talking to others etc will give you help in being yourself when you're around others. Good luck! Just to add something—-confidence is what makes most people like someone.

You can’t. If they don't from the first couple pf interactions getting to know you decently well, they never will. You have to meet their standards of looks, personality, lifestyle, viewpoints, and click well overall together. If someone does not love you now, and knows you generally well even surface level, that person NEVER will. It sucks, trust me I know. Just don’t go looking for someone, because you may end up falling in love with someone that does not love you, and then you will never be the same. Wait until someone comes who falls in love with you and hopefully then you fall in love with them too. It is a matter of luck, luck of meeting the person, and luck of being born with traits that match your innate desire for a specific type of person. I wish you luck.

You can’t *make* anyone do anything. It’s their choice, not yours. But to give yourself a decent chance of them deciding to like you, you could try being a good person, being genuine, dependable, loyal, trustworthy, having steady employment, place to live, car, paying all your bills, not playing mind games, having some interesting hobbies/interests (and finding someone who shares them), interesting things to talk about, etc. Nobody likes game playing, mindgames, mindfucks, negging, insincerity, etc.

A2A. This question comes up quite often on Quora. The answer is: You can’t. Whether someone falls in love with you or not is entirely up to that person. The only thing you can do is turn yourself into the kind of person that other people tend to fall in love with: Take care of your physical appearance, develop attractive personality traits such as empathy, kindness, and charm, hone attractive talents like cooking, and have a decent career. If you have all those things, then any person would be lucky to have you and it’s only a matter of time before you find your match. Good luck.

Better question: why would you want to? Have you met many people? A lot of them suck.  Also, watch trying to please everyone; when you're off pleasing one, you may end up hurting someone else more important to you in the process. Learn to love yourself, then you won't have to worry about making everyone else love you.  Worrying about what everyone else thinks about you is only going to give you a headache and anxiety.

response.answer_text: I have been in a similar situation with my ex..we broke and then i ask her for one more chance than she says  "once differences arises it is difficult to revive that old bonding" but still i make all the best efforts i can make but failed to get her back.  So its better to move on but if you can be her friend forever than you can, it may happen that she starts feeling for you again.

You can’t make a guy fall in love with you. To insinuate that this is even possible assumes that you are going to somehow manipulate or control a guy into falling in love with you. If you are a person with a strong identity, vision for your life, and someone that is kind and in touch with their femininity, I can almost guarantee you that some guy will come along and sweep you off of your feet. However, if you are obviously insecure and trying really hard to “hook” a guy, most of the quality guys will run the other direction.

It certainly is possible. Its just that you need to know the right person to do it. Several situations can be created to make a person start feeling for you. It requires a lot of effort and time and some true feelings to get through. However, if the other person strictly denies any proposals, its better to let go as your efforts could easily be looked upon as desperation and more driven by self respect being hurt.

Be yourself. If a woman cannot love you with all your flaws or can't understand who you are, then she doesn't deserve you. Love is about the long haul, honesty, trust, forgiveness and respect.  A real woman will not judge a man for his past and will not expect him to be than himself for the future. A real woman will understand the true meaning of partnership and encouragement. A real woman will let the man be the man and listen to him. Loyalty is the essence of a real woman.  Sometimes we don't understand certain things. A real woman trusts what the man says, even if he is not really saying it.  Good luck in finding that real woman.

If you want someone to fall inlove with you and stay inlove with you I believe that you need to be yourself. What they see is what they get. No masks, no pretentions and no role playing. Remember that acts has their limits. Masks always reveal its own mystery and no secrets are being revealed. So when that time comes their feelings will fade cause they think youve change when the truth this is the real you. Be proud of yourself. Our uniqueness is our ticket to happiness.

You can’t. Love is not force. Love is developed. However, you can showcase yourself. You can be there for them, show them you care. Enjoy them as a person; treat them the way you wanted to be treated. Learn their love language. There’s no perfect formula. Sometimes our negative sides and little things that we thing don’t count are the ones our loved one sees in us. <3 Love is a journey of acceptance and understanding. It’s tested through time and situations.

No. Falling in love is very personal. If someone is attracted they will be and it will be easy to encourage them to fall in love - be kind, be funny, be honest. But if they aren’t attracted it’s pretty hard to make that happen, although you might still using the same techniques, but with far less likelihood of success. Just think about it in reverse: you must have seen people you think you could fall in love with easily… and lots of people you can’t possibly imagine falling in love with even if you knew they had millions of dollars to share if you did.

You can't make people fall in love with you. But let's say that you did succeed, that person is not actually going to be in love with YOU but rather a deceiving version of you. People should fall in love with YOU not a version, you should not change yourself to make people like you because in the end, that doesn't work out

I have read some comment and they are not telling you one thing. Love happens faster when there is space and the girl keeps thinking about you. Don't let her know your feelings and make her feel uncertainty will make her think more about you which will make her fall for you. If you smother her she might say I love you but it is a different type of love. It isn't being in love with you.

Woah.. looks like someone wants the recipe for instant noodles?! Firstly, you can't make anyone fall in love with you, it happens naturally/gradually and even if you manage to do that forcefully by wooing someone that inevitably doesn't happen "instantly." A good relationship needs to be nurtured with love and care, honest communication, willingness to work through difficulties and disagreements. Don't fall in for the "instant fix trap". Take your time to know and understand each other better. All the best!

You cannot. No matter how much effort you put into your relationship, they will never feel the same way about you. It is a possibility that they might start liking you as a friend but love is not something that can be asked for. It is always given. So instead of wasting your time trying to change that person’s opinion about you, learn your own worth.

You cant make someone fall in love with you, they are humans with emotions as well and they will fall in love with you when they feel as if they do feel that same way. Yes, but not in a sense of controlling ones feelings towards you, if they dont love you back? Then no but it can change, its a possibility and its best you believe that someone will have feelings towards you.

Based on the details you left, I'm afraid to say that you have virtually no chance of being with this person. If you want to attract people, you can't live your life as an asshole. Good people attract other good people. A bad person will never attract a good person. There is hope for you however. Start acting kindly and graciously to people (all people), especially people that can do nothing for you. You must be genuine about this. It cannot be an act. In time, you'll begin to attract good people. If you don't do this, you'll never be happy. You'll only see other people as tools and people don't like to be used, so they will avoid you, and you'll die alone. Good luck.

You can't force someone to love you - all you can do is put yourself out there and hope for the best! If you feel a spark, an instant chemistry with someone - that's when you know you have a definite chance. It's exciting getting to know someone romantically before developing connections through past experience, interests, goals, while also learning how they respond to the world. The person of interest also gets to learn all of these things about you. Remember to be yourself though, you don't want to end up being with someone you don't feel comfortable with!

1. Be respectful towards others. 2. Talk sense. 3. Do what you enjoy. 4. Have an aim in your life. 5. Stay away from hypocrisy and artifice. 6. Be honest in your endeavours. 7. Most importantly remember you cannot please everyone under the sun.  Hope this helps!

Talk, talk & talk lots so as to understand each other! There is nothing better than communicating. Its good to know each other & its better to know what your are getting into!Be your best but make sure you understand each other's devils! so as to accept the worst! Eventually make the other person realize that he/she means a lot & is special! Rest is up to them! Always remember you can't make anyone love you... but you can always stay lovable! :) best of luck!

Do not try to make someone fall in love with you— to try this is selfish and contrary to the spirit of love. Instead, be patient, and simply love broadly and wisely and the magnetism of your personality that results will automatically attract those those whom you should be with. You need not obsess about love or get caught up in desire for another. Simply be your best and most worthy self, and right relationships will happen spontaneously when the time is right. And be aware that the person whom you are draw to at the moment may or may not be one with whom you can and should form a deep and lasting relationship.

You cannot make someone love you.  You can, however, be yourself, always; and if there is someone that you love, then show them. Don't tell them. Show them. Cupid's arrows strike where they will. Either love will blossom in their heart for you or not.  Whether it does or not, showing someone love and doing things for them because you love them...that's never a bad thing.

Original question was: “Do you know how to make people love you?” No, I don’t know how to make people love me. However, I do know how to make myself love people. I’ve been mostly successful in that direction for almost 64 years now — especially in the last 41 years of my marriage. So, this is definitely the voice of experience speaking.

Be what you are.Atleast you will get someone who really loves you. Don't try to impress everyone.Lots of love.Thank you. :)

If you really want to get someone love and get benefits for make colorful and delightful life. To convince someone, no need to put a lot of efforts. You cannot get anybody to love you. They either do or they don’t. It’s that simple. It appears that you’re trying to get a particular person to fall in love with you. Just know that in this case, the more you try, the more you will fail. My advice; just be about improving yourself and enjoying your life right now, meet new people. You will definitely catch someone’s attention by just being you and enjoying your life.

Be genuine and don’t be afraid to show your flaws - the more human you seem, the approachable you are. Be patient - the other person is a separate human being and they have their own flow of timing and feelings. Make them feel they are interesting - Be interested in them and let them talk about themselves. This leaves bigger impression than when you try to be the most interesting.

To make someone in love with you, you must first be in love with them. Don't tell them you in love with them but show them. Ask for a date with them. Touch them but not in a forceful way, grabbing their hands while crossing the road or touch them while showing them something. Compliment and flirt with them. Love takes time but attraction takes seconds, so alway move things forward eventually they will fall in love with you.

There are many ways to make a guy fall in love… You can try any of these- 1)Try Spending more time with him 2)Share your day to day experiences with him 3)If he is interested in you then he will also start sharing stuff about his life 4)Text frequently, but not daily(because few guys feel irritated) 5)Try helping him if he has any problems 6)Keep in mind just one thing and make him feel the same- There may be many people who will be waiting to help you in bad situations but there will be only few who would like to enjoy with you in the time of success without feeling jealous and willing to make you more happier. Be the one for him. 7)Be candid and honest 8)Make him feel special

“First of all we can’t force someone to love us” Love is unconditional, if we force someone to love us then its not a love we can’t force someone to feel the same as we feel for them. If we change ourself for someone or to get back his love then it would be a pleasure for some time but as the time passes we regret ourself to become a part of his life. Be the same as you are don’t try to change for the sake of others or get back something.Love them without any condition without expecting anything in return your passion and true love for him makes him to love you rather than making efforts to make him love you.

You can't make anyone do  anything, least of all make them fall in love with you.   What you can do is be the best that you can be and let others get to know the  real you. Most love affairs start from a friendship. Take it slow you'll get there :)

The only person you can make fall in love with you is YOU. What? Yes…. it’s true. You must love yourself first - or you do not have the capacity to give the kind of love and attract the kind of love you are looking for, because you have yet to find it within to the highest and greatest degree. This sounds like a simple and strange formula, but it is true.

I am sorry to say, but it's not in your hand. Don't try to make someone fall in love. If you are trying something different than who you are , it's not you he/she will love. Be yourself, and that's enough to make someone like you. As of love that takes time. But , don't do something you would not, just to make someone fall in love.

I was going through that same thing w my ex . i honestly beleive that in order to accomplish ot there would h ave to be a little love to start with. Mine i do believe deep deep down its very possible theres a very little there .as long as u think there is and they arnt see anyone else . they are going to see that you changed the things that made them fall out of love. Good luck

You can not make anyone love you. They either do or don’t. Some people believe that you have certain powers to influence people in certain directions. But if it is meant to be then it will be there. Otherwise I think that you are better off to put your attentions somewhere where they are better received and mutually shared.

You can’t , it takes two to be in a relationship. One sided relationship always result in dissapointment and resentment. The best is to be your self and find a guy or girl who appreciate you for you. Shaping your self into the person you love wants , will only be exhausting for you in the long run. One day you will give up and the relationship will fall apart . Comptiabilty is the key success to any log term partnership

It is so odd that we frequently use the term “make” people do this or that. Other words for that might be “manipulate”, “force”, or “trick”. Love means so much to us precisely because it is freely given and simultaneously mutual. So, if you forced or tricked or manipulated or MADE someone “love” you, would it truly be love and would it be satisfying? No. If you did those things and got your victim to be with YOU—away from other people, what would be the name for that? Mental illness, personality disorder, terrifying, illegal? It would not be Love.

Falling in love is a beautiful feeling. To let go of all your safety masks and let the other one to see all your wounds, scars, cracks and edges of your whole being is indeed courageous and blissful experience. But remember, you can't love someone into loving you, that's selfish! Love is all selfless and free, love is a choice. Never try to force someone into it, never, that way you lose the essence of love. Once you start forcing things, it becomes obsession not love!

If you are also suffering from the same situation then we “The Power of Dua” is there to help you. We can take you out of this situation with our Dua in Islam to make someone fall in Love with you. This dua will help you in controlling the situation. Dua to Make Someone Love You will help you in getting your desired love from your loved one. Our dua will help you to overcome from any situation.

Well, it sounds like he is saying he loves you to get something from you. I am sure you have heard this before, but you can't make someone love you. And the only way you can tell someone loves you is by their actions. (My credentials:I've been happily married for 24 years.)

If you're trying to please everyone, then you're not going to make anything that is honestly yours, I don't think, in the long run. --Viggo Mortensen  I don't know the key to success, but the key to failure is trying to please everybody.--Bill Cosby

There is an old saying about a horse and water and getting it to drink? Same idea. If you want love, become love and the water your horse is meant to drink is where you’ll find your true love. So many try to force the issue they really lose the security of love. It’s not so much what you do, it is what you have to offer, and that is yourself. Love is a funny ride. When you find a love to follow, follow it with all your heart.

assuming he was in love with you and now he is no more in love with you which indict that you have done something to loss his love either you treat him wrong or you act needy or anything regardless what it is and regardless what ever going on you have to be your authentic self first and for most be who you were when he fall for you do not change your personality or anything about you and do not try to be strategical about it either be the person he fall for that girl he liked and if you made mistake own up to it and apologize and keep in mind he may not fall for you again but there is a good chance he will if he is not seeing anyone

You can love yourself and be the leader in the campaign that leads others to love you. You can lighten the burden of their suffering by providing them with humor, courage and direction or in short leadership. You can’t really control the behavior of others.The thing you can truly give others is information. Give them information that makes them think you are lovable. Tell them stories of your heroic conquests and let them know others love you. Hold a gigantic frame of mind. I hope all the best for you.

You might not have a chance to make her love you again. It depends a lot on why she stopped loving you in the first place. It's usually best not to count on or rely on being able to attract someone who has already broken up with you.

You can’t MAKE people fall in love with you. You can optimise the chances that love will blossom, but you cannot actually FORCE someone to reciprocate any affection you feel. Be presentable. Pay attention to people. Smile. Be kind. Cherish people for what they are.
Tell them you are going to die in few days, and you want to give that 1,00000000  Rupees to someone who loves you.

The joke answer would be: "yeah, buy them [insert topical reference here]" and we would all fall back and laugh. But in all seriousness, yes it is actually possible.   You may need to seek the help of a wizened alchemist to conjure the right potion. Otherwise you could try summoning Venus, goddess of love. Long shot I know, but she has been known to interfere with the lives of mortals.

Well as you can see from the wide and varied answers, Opinions vary. Love is a strange thing to say the least. Especially the deep and abiding kind that is long lasting. There is absolutely no way to Make someone love you. Love is a very natural process that occurs. Just because you love someone does not obligate them to love you back. Get to know this person and see what they are really all about and see if you still have the same feelings for them. If you do then express how you feel and go from there. Best of luck to you and I hope this helped in some small fashion

Eye contact. You can do everything else right, but if you don’t get plenty of quality time staring into each others eyeballs, you two will eventually be history. But pass somebody on the street, if your eyes meet for more than a split second? Guaranteed you’ll be thinking about each other for days. Even if you never talked or did anything together.

I need to know more to answer specifically.  Is this person someone you are in relationship with and want to love you in return? Or is this a how do I get anyone to love me?  If the latter people generally have an idea of what they want in relationship usually based on their particular values. There is an increased potential for love when values are shared. Hint: Know what your values are.  Find out what their value are.

See. Firstly you're an idiot. He's your boyfriend so by syllogism he loves you and you know it. If you don't then why are you in it ?So he loves you okay?Moving on, there's nothing like crazy deep love unless and until you want shahrukh Khan from Darr which I really hope you don't.love is the most serene emotion ever present. I think you're missing or not getting the fun out of your relationship.What you can do keep him clingy is that something that he craves for or likes like for example, if he's a foodie you've got to go out for food and stuff, or maybe cook, or if you guys are good physically then try new stuff that he hasn't ever done or known, but make sure that he'll like it when you propose.  He's in love with you, thats enough.What you guys need to be is crazy.  Have fun.

In response to : How can you make someone fall in love? Never entice them with money! You can’t make someone love you if they don’t! You are setting yourself up for a failed relationship. One sided love can’t make their heart feel something it won’t! You won’t see it in their eyes, because it is NOT there! Nothing but hurt will come of it for you both. Take sex out of the equation and what is left? No matter what you do to entice them if sex or money is the only thing connecting you, know that the relationship is doomed for failure.
